alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Union; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 11:26PM CDT until April 13 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Caldwell Parish in north central Louisiana... Jackson Parish in north central Louisiana... Union Parish in north central Louisiana... Northeastern Natchitoches Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Ouachita Parish in north central Louisiana... Eastern Lincoln Parish in north central Louisiana... Northern Winn Parish in north central Louisiana... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1125 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Cooley to 11 miles northeast of Winnfield, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Winnfield, Jonesboro, Columbia, Swartz, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Farmerville, Richwood, Sterlington, Clarks, Grayson, Choudrant, Marion, Chatham, Hodge, Goldonna and Dodson. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Union; Winn
